page.title: 01The Beaulieu River
page.content: The area contained in this grid borders on the New Forest and is mainly gorse and heather broken by small copses - home to a variety of small wildlife-birds in particular abound here, to nme a few, pheasant mingle with geese which visit each Autumn, Plover, all types of small specis plus the ever hunting Sparrow-hawks and Kestrels. The New forest Poinies and cattle owned by commoners and allowed to graze by the Verderers Court (yes, still today!) complete the wildlife picture. there are only two villages of note 1) Exbury, the home of the de Rothschilds - The main house is now practically derelict, but the gardens are known world wide for the specialist shrubs and trees grown there-the village houses are totally inhabited by the big house staff.
